content.description: In an experiment, three different animals were exposed to a series of environmental temperatures and their body temperatures were assessed at multiple temperature points between 10 and 40 degrees Celsius. Ten different individuals of each type of animal were included in the study to produce an average body temperature profile for each type of animal. Figure 1 shows the data collected.
content.question: Figure 1. Effect of environmental temperature on body temperature of selected animals Which of the following statements is most consistent with the data in Figure 1 ?

choices.label: Armadillos tend to be more metabolically active than either gerbils or snakes are.
Armadillos cannot survive at environmental temperatures over <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>30</mtext><mi>Â°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Snakes are found in terrestrial rather than aquatic environments.
Snakes display behaviors that allow them to absorb or radiate heat as required.

content.answer: Snakes display behaviors that allow them to absorb or radiate heat as required.
